content:
Two related questions: 1) Is it possible to update from a lower major release version to a higher major release version of a module from within the UI?
2) Can I gain access to designate which version is recommended by backdropcms.org project listing, or do I need to ping somebody specific each time?

Last time I checked (was many months ago), you could specify the preferred version by editing either the project node, or the specific release node. I can't see any such option any longer :shrug: ...perhaps @jenlampton knows?

...I would like us to eventually port and use something like https://www.drupal.org/project/nodeownership (I like its email notification options), or use one of the many node access modules (I think that https://github.com/backdrop-contrib/nodeaccess_userreference is the best-fitting), so that we are able to specify users as project maintainers, and allow them to manage their projects/releases on their own.

backdrop-contrib/nodeaccess_userreference
Gives content access permissions to users for content that references the users with User reference or Entity reference. - backdrop-contrib/nodeaccess_userreference

We don't have recommended versions yet. Right now the latest is always the
recommended.
Oh, this is bringing back a memory... I think we have a hidden tab.
@Larynuntil we can get github account verification + maintainer verification you'll need to ping an editor to make a release recommended. But since we also trust you we can make you an editor
@Laryn you already are an editor :) Can you try the node/NID/edit/releases and see if you can access it?
@klonos we can also change the author of any node to give that person edit access. (For future reference - if someone asks you for edit access to a node for a project they maintain)
but that secret /releases thing should be fixed
@Laryn I've changed the recommended version to 3.x for you.
@jenlampton is that issue with the Project module?
@Laryn do you want me to also mark 1.x as unsupported?
@klonos no I think it might be the Seven theme (core issue)? the sub-tabs aren't showing
@klonos yes that would be great, thanks!
